CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant had an accident at work . The insurance company paid him an occupational injury pension until DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant applied to have the pension continued from DATE . On DATE the insurance company rejected his application finding that the applicant ’s work capacity had been reduced by PERCENT . It further held that the applicant ’s inability to return to his previous profession as a carpenter was not the result of the injury sustained during the accident , but of pains which had not been caused by the accident .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant appealed to ORG ( tapaturmalautakunta , olycksfallsnämnden ) , repeating his requests . He relied on a medical opinion dated DATE in which he was found to be unfit for carpentry work . He also submitted further medical opinions . ORG rejected his appeal on DATE . It ruled , inter alia , that he was incapable of full - time carpentry work . However , the applicant ’s pains were not caused by the accident and therefore could not be compensated under LAW .

CARDINAL . The applicant , represented by a lawyer , appealed to ORG ( vakuutusoikeus , försäkringsdomstolen ) submitting further evidence . On DATE the court rejected the bulk of his appeal . However , it modified ORG decision so as to grant the applicant a PERCENT occupational injury pension for the period from DATE , during which the applicant had participated in a work - testing project . The case was referred back to the insurance company for further measures .

CARDINAL . On acquainting himself with his case file at the office of ORG registry , he found CARDINAL documents which he claimed had not been communicated to him . In his application for leave to appeal to ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) he claimed , inter alia , that he had not been sent all the documents relevant to his case .
CARDINAL . ORG refused the applicant leave to appeal on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , using an extraordinary procedure , requested ORG to annul its decision and that of ORG . He argued that the latter court had failed to send him documents .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected his application . It found that the non - communicated documents related to decision - making within the insurance company and that the documents had not been submitted to the court in connection with the parties’ submissions or relied on by the court in reaching its decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application ( no . CARDINAL ) with ORG against GPE . He alleged , in particular , that he had been denied a fair hearing within the meaning of LAW on account of the failure to provide him with an opportunity to comment on some documents which had been included in his case file . On DATE the ORG held unanimously that there had been no violation of LAW .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , the case was pending before the insurance company . On DATE the insurance company decided that the new medical evidence submitted was not capable of changing the conclusions of ORG in its decision of DATE . The insurance company found that , even though the applicant was incapable of full - time carpentry work , he was capable of other work .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG against the insurance company ’s decision . In his appeal , which became pending before ORG on DATE , he requested compensation for total incapacity for work . On DATE the Board held an oral hearing . On DATE it modified the insurance company ’s decision , changing the applicant ’s handicap allowance category from CARDINAL and ordering the insurance company to pay him a PERCENT occupational injury pension for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . As concerned the time after that date , the case was referred back to the insurance company . ORG found that the applicant was still capable of working in another profession where his earnings could reach CARDINAL the level of his earnings before the accident . ORG referred to his relatively young age and DATE that he could expect to work .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed to ORG , repeating his requests . On DATE the court ordered the insurance company to pay the applicant a PERCENT occupational injury pension for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE and rejected the remainder of the claims . Referring to several medical opinions , the court estimated that the applicant ’s ability to work had been reduced from DATE onwards , when he started treatment for pain .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed to ORG which , on DATE , refused leave to appeal .

CARDINAL . According to section PERSON ( CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) of LAW ( tapaturmavakuutuslaki , lagen om olycksfallsförsäkring ) , an appeal against a decision of an insurance company must be submitted to the company in question . If the company can not change the decision appealed against , it must refer the case , together with its opinion , to ORG within DATE from DATE appeal period or , if the time - limit has been extended , at the latest within DATE from DATE of appeal .
